answers.answer: Omg!! Thanksfor posting this I am waiting on my rresults for the 3 hour test to see if I have gestational diabetes. I hope your lil one will cook longer. I know mine better stay as long as she can :).

Thank for sharing. It really scare me. My blood sugar level was high in the begining of my pregnancy. Last week my doctor test me at 18w and my sugar level had decreased. It was on the border to be consider as diabetes. Has it ever happened to u?

When i found out I had diabeties i was at 5.1 and if I was 5.0 that would mean i dont have it, honestly if you do have it cut out everybiy of sugar you can and test your blood when they tell you to, if you dont took have à High riel of having a really big baby 10-15 lbs and we all know that wount be fun

I forgot to mention in the post that if you do start having contractions Early ask for the steriod shot to open his lungs ! They dont allways do it right away and you will have to ask but its for if you baby does come really ealrly like mine allmost did (7months) it will open his lungs and mature his organes and such if he does come out ealry so thermes à Higher chance of survival!!!!

Thanks for sharing. I didnt know it could cause that. Im already worried i might deliver early and have been doing research on it. I didnt know about the steroid shot either. I will def keep that in mind.
With any form of diabetes ( even if its 1 or 2 before pregnancy ) you are at increased risk of premature labour
Ididnt know it was any diabeties !  These are the things doctors Should tell you about !

I have my appointment on the 7th to find out.  I think I will have it though.  I've eaten nothing but snacks, junk food,  And fast food through out my pregnancy.  I also was experiencing intense B&H contractions on the 20th at 27 weeks. I'll have to ask my doctor about this and what I can do to prevent it.

I am 18weeks pregnant this is my 2nd pregnant and I have type 1 diabetes my 1st pregnancy went great I had my daughter at 36 and half weeks and she was healthy at 8lb 3oz if you listen to your.doctor you really don't have anything to worry about this pregnancy is going amazing and so far my baby is healthy
My doc said it has nothing to do with what you eat or anything

question: 3 weeks ago I found out I had gestational diabetes so I would of been 26 weeks, last week I got sent to the hospital due to contractions I had no idea what was going on this is my first baby and I knew it was to early, so went to the birthing unit in the hospital and was admitted for 2 night 3 days and was told if they don't stop mycontractions iI will give both this week, they ended up stopping the contraction so I asked if theres anything that would of caused this (they knew about the diabetes ) and they said no there's nothing that causes it it just happens he just wants to see his mommy, so I left the hospital never worried about if this will happen again this early but it's been fine, I ended up having a diabetes appointment yesterday and they told me that because I have diabetes is why I went into labour and there's nothing toprevent it. So for all you moms who have gestational diabetes and have and signs of contractions even if you think there false PLEASE go to the hospital it may be the real thing !! It's really scary yes ! But it will be even more scary having your baby really early. I'm really sorry how long this was and my bad grammer.
title: ALL EXPECTING MOM PLEASE READ!!
